intro: Tibouchina laevicaulis, commonly known as the smoothleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from pink to red. The plant typically has glossy, elliptical leaves that are smooth to the touch, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Tibouchina laevicaulis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
